text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Gerard a cloud support
engineer here at the AWS office in
Dublin today I will show you how to
reset the admin user password for your
Amazon relational database service TB
instance through the RDS management
conso let's get
started first open the Amazon RS
console from the navigation pin choose
databases
select the DB instance that has the
password that you want to modify and
then choose
modify from Amazon or cluster first
expand the cluster select the instance
with the writer or reader R and then
choose
modify in the modify DB instance page
scroll down to the setting sections in
the master password field enter the new
password that you want to
use and confirm the master password
not that this password change is
asynchronous so the changes are applied
as soon as possible without requiring
you to restart the
instance scroll down to the end of the
page and choose
continue review the changes and then
choose modify instance to apply the
changes the DB instance status shows
resetting Master credential while the
change is in progress
when the changes are complete the status
changes to available now you can connect
using the new
password and that's how you reset the
admin user password for an Amazon Rd sdb
instance thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
